name: Marina Del Rey Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a moderately-priced hotel with everything the overnight traveler might need while moving through southern California.
reviews.title: Reasonably Priced for Passers-Through LA area

likes.liked: — Great Central Location to LA, Santa Monica
likes.disliked: — Iron burn marks in the carpet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tasty soft-baked cookies and hot cider in the lobby when we checked in. Concierge was nice and friendly, Room was clean, shower was strong, nice view of the marina, but no balcony. Unlike a lot of places in LA, there was parking! Convenient location to Santa Monica and LA. It was cool out, so we didn't use the pool. but it looked clean. Only gripe was 2 iron burn marks on the carpet from previous inhabitants, but I guess there's no remedy for sloppy people...
reviews.title: Nothing fancy but rooms clean and large

reviews.text: We booked one night at the Marina Del Rey on Hotels.com on our way to San Francisco and Napa. Total price for Sunday was lower than the low price on tripadvisor. We decided to save money and spent it in Napa...
reviews.title: Nice Place, Spectaculer Views

reviews.text: I would stay again.
reviews.title: Awful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights when we first arrived into LA from Australia. Booked a standard room with King bed, room was clean and a good size, hotel was an older style and could do with updating but compare to hotels in are was good value.
reviews.title: Book With Caution!!

likes.liked: — harbor location and close proximty to my medical facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed six nights at the Marina Del Rey Hotel in July, 2007, and I must say it was a very nice experience! The location is by far the best of all of the hotels surrounding the marina, and the quietness of this somewhat vintage hotel was marvelous. They have free parking and it's close in! The staff is very courteous and helpful, the maid service is outstanding, and the marina view is simply breathtaking. There were a couple of quirky little glitches -- our phone didn't work (but we had cells, so it was no big deal) and the elevator went on the blink for a brief couple of hours, but other than that we had a wonderful stay and will definitely come back again. One day, we walked over to check to the "big" expensive hotel across the way, and found that place to be a little stuffy and impersonal. We were glad we chose our hotel instead. The Marina Del Rey Hotel is definitely worth considering!
reviews.title: It was Great!
NO COMPLAINTS
reviews.text: As a woman by herself I stayed at this hotel for eight days and found the staff to be absolutely delightful, friendly, caring and they could not do enough for me. My phone bill was rather large and they even called to advise me of a cheaper way of making calls. (That's a first for a hotel where profit is key).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was unhappy with the first room but they offered me a second one which was fabulous. It was large, overlooking the pool and harbour and immaculately clean; cleaned daily and thoroughly.
reviews.title: Absolutely disgusting
Gave Me the Willies
reviews.text: They allowed me to keep my bike overnight in their store room and at no extra charge.

The car park was very large so parking was always easy. It is also in a great location, walking distance to Mother's Beach, Fisherman's Village and Venice Beach. Close to great restaurants, supermarkets and designer shops.
reviews.title: Avoid this dump
What a dump
reviews.text: Based on the reviews, I was expecting an OK room. I was wrong. My coworker and I both had rooms that were disgusting--extremely stained carpets, drapes that had burn holes, broken furniture and door locks that didn't work. The beds were uncomfortable and the noise from the hallway was very loud. The staff did not even ask the reason when we checked out after one night. Quite frankly, neither of us felt safe in the hotel.

When we arrived in the front lobby I was impressed. The hotel looked great, airy and bright. My workmate got a gorgeous bay front room with a balcony. I got a "cityview" room which looked mostly right into a concrete slab blocking all light and any view and directly above the awning of the front entry-way. I had to turn all the lights on at 2 pm in the afternoon. It was quite dispiriting. Yes, there were many iron burns and stains on the carpets, everything seemed kind of worn and gray and dirty and there were discarded fast food drink cups thrown out on the window sill. The sink was running non-stop. They sent someone to kind of fix it, but could not change my room. Then, late at night when I went to brush my teeth, water just gushed out of the faucet and could not be turned off. I had to bail out the sink with the coffee pot to keep the room from flooding! The guy came up again and turned off all the hot water to the sink.
reviews.title: Variable--Great if you get a decent room

likes.liked: — The location and the running paths

reviews.text: The next day they shifted my room, and I had a light, airy, cityview room with a balcony. I was happy for the rest of my stay. I spent a lot of time working in my room (free wireless internet connection). I went running all along the bayfront every day. I walked to the nearby shopping center for meals and coffee (there is a Peet's and a Starbucks nearby). There is also a Ralph's and a healthfood store in the shopping center. This is a gorgeous place to walk and run along the bay in both directions, and really, really quiet at night (are we still in LA?!!) The hotel has a lovely swimming pool. The restaurant is overpriced, but has a nice view. With several restaurants nearby, you don't really have to eat at the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Vaue
Great position, shame about the rooms.
reviews.text: So, I think this was a great place to stay, especially for the low price, but you really have to make sure you do not get the rooms in the front directly above or below the awning over the entryway because they have this wierd concrete thing blocking the window, and people stand below chatting and blowing cigarette smoke up into whatever little window space you have. It seems like some rooms are lovely and reasonably well-maintained, and others are just depressing and shabby. The location is absolutely fantastic, and the staff was pretty friendly, including the repairman who went out of his way to help me.

We were slightly concerned after reading the reviews but it just goes to show that you cant believe what you read. This hotel was excellent value and the staff were very helpful. As I had recently broken my leg we were allicated a room on the ground floor so expected a little noise from the rooms above. In fact there was little noise at all. The room was largeand comfortable and was cleaned every day. The staff helped to locate a wheelchair for me and even rang the car rental company when our sat nav broke down. The setting of the hotel was beautiful and as it was at the end of the harbour there was no traffic noise. The location was excellent as it was close to most tourist attractions in the area. We would definately recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Very good service!

likes.liked: — Wireless internet included in the price... and the general service incl. late check out possibility
likes.disliked: — That the stairway was so far away that you simply had to wait for one of the two elevators

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in April. It is a great location, but a sad old hotel. We had a room with a delightful view and enjoyed some great walks around the area but as far as inside the hotel.......it has well and truly seen its hey day! The foyer had a mighty chandelier that was badly in need of a clean and it is a pity that it has been allowed to become to rundown. The room was old and jaded with wall paper peeling off the walls, stained carpet and a bathroom of eclectic white tiles and wallpaper held together with sticky tape.The balcony had fake grass matting that was threadbare and an eyesore. It was way overpriced for the quality of accommodation, obviously priced only for the location. We would have moved except the purpose of the stay was to relax after a frenetic time and the waterview and walks enabled that..The resturant was fine for breakfast with a lovely waterview and the afternoon treats for guests in the lobby were very welcome after a day out and about.
reviews.title: wait till it is renovated

reviews.text: I believe it will be renovated so I recommend you wait till then.
reviews.title: euuu
Give it a miss
reviews.text: This place is in need of a refresh. It looks and smells like 1977. Never again

I booked a three day stay at the Marina Del Ray Hotel in June 2007. I booked the hotel directly from their website. The location and views looked fantastic and to be honest they were. The problem was with the interior itself, We arrived at the hotel around 4pm and had a short wait until the room was ready. Everything looked promising, the hotel lobby was clean and of a good standard and the Marina looked great. I was happy with the place, that is until I was given the key to the room. We were on the 3rd floor with a Marina view and the doubts started to set in once I got out of the lift on the 3rd floor. Whilst walking to the room I noticed the carpets were stained and dirty. This was nothing compared to the one in the room. The carpet had large and numerous permanent stains, it did not fit the room properley, the furniture was old, marked and battered, and the balcony furniture, whilst supposedly white, was filthy. Not something you would want to sit on whilst you admired the view.
reviews.title: In a great location, but needs updating

likes.disliked: — It was tired, small pillows, smell of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On complaining to the staff I was told the only other room available was a smoking room, not ideal. I took a look at this room but it had the same problem. The hotel is in need for a major internal overhaul.
reviews.title: Good for Boats

description: Set against the blue waters and gleaming boats of the world’s largest man made small-craft harbor, Marina del Rey Hotel is an oasis of leisure and elegance in sunny Southern California. Hotel guests can relax amid the soothing waters of the Pacific and lush, tropical gardens brilliant with color. You will enjoy our resort's unique position at the tip of Bali Peninsula, with excellent access to boating, sailing, fishing and a variety of water sports.
